1.content:
Who would've thought such incredible things could happen to one person. David's own extraordinary situation started a few days earlier in an isolated cabin, and that book....

No, no. Not THAT book. This was a different cabin and a far different book.

He wouldn't have found it if he hadn't gotten himself lost, and yet it was almost faith that he came upon it. He'd been walking for miles,he'd lost his compass, his GPS was totally non functional. Last time he'd buy anything off ebay. He was still in among the mountains so he couldn't get any cell phone service. On top of all this it was getting dark and he saw storm clouds from the east, so when he came upon the decrepit cabin he was glad for even that much shelter.

Who knows how long ago it had been built. The roof sagged, it was almost completely covered in a thick layer of moss and whatever road or trail that might've lead up to it was long gone. The doorknob turned easy, but the hinges refused to budge and David had to put his shoulder into it to open the door enough to squeeze through. It surprised him that the door hadn't broken apart under the weight. The inside looked just as bad as the outside and smelled musky. Oddly, he didn't notice any signs of animals taking up residence within the abandoned shack. Taking off his pack, David light his lamp. The lamp illuminated enough of the interior for him to notice the one item in the cabin that seemed to be uncorrupted.

It looked to be bound in brown leather and when David touched it, it felt warm to the touch. He concluded it must've been the light shining in through the only window that was not covered by vegetation.

He'd look at it later, at that moment David's concern was to set up his tent on the floor of the cabin. He could hear drops of rain on the roof and he had no way of knowing whether or not the roof leaked. when he'd had that done and his sleeping bag rolled out he turned his attention back to the book. The first thing he noticed as he opened the book that the pages were made not from paper. Of what exactly he wasn't sure but he knew it wasn't paper. Second, it was hand written and illustrated but he couldn't read the writing. About halfway through it he found a scrap of yellowed paper someone had placed there. Holding the paper to the lamp light he read out loud what was written on it.

"Klaatu.... barada.... nikto"

He waited. Nothing. Nothing at all.

Carefully replacing the scrap of paper back into the book and putting the book back on the table, he blew out the lamp and climbed into the tent. Sleep though hadn't come easy, the rumble of thunder was loud, so loud that he could feel it through the ground. What David didn't know was that the Thunder Storm had covered up a far more extraordinary event. While he tried to sleep, the world around him changed.

And when David awoke....

14.content:
With a groan, David slowly began to open his eyes to a familiar light. However, once his vision finally came to focus, the familiarity quickly vanished as he gave a startled gasp.The sight before David was without a doubt a Shock. "w-w-what the!?" Before his very form was what appeared to look like a Kitchen, though not like any other average one. This Kitchen compared to the many so called 'average' ones he recalled so vividly was shear massive in size. Not even the greatest of skyscrapers back Earth would be able to compare to the shear height of the wooden ceiling high Above. "w-w-where the hell am I!?" he mutters shaking his head in utter disbelief. Was this some kind of sick twisted dream he was having? As an experiment to test whether or not this was some illusion of his imagination, he quickly pinches the side of his cheek as hard as he could. If he couldn't feel any pain than that would surely prove that this was nothing more than fake vision. After giving a cringe and small grunt as a sudden twinge of pain emerged on his face, his eyes widen in great horror. "t-t-this isn't a dream...It's Real!"

Within moments, the sudden sounds of explosive thumps as well as the tremors of what could only be related to an earthquake emerged towards his right. With the quickest of haste, his head spun towards the direction to only gaze in shock upon two massive beings. The first massive being to enter shockingly looked like that of a grizzly bear carrying a surprisingly humanoid body. Her height and simple blue dress gave her a similar appearance to that of a middle aged woman back on Earth. Behind her was a massive white furred wolfess garbed in a rather poofy white blouse fastened with a brown leather vest. Below she was wearing a long green skirt stopping right above the ankles of her padded, furred feet.

"Thanks for offering to help me cook today Luna." The Bear woman says while making her way to the massive sink at the other side of the room.

"No problem at all." The Wolfess named Luna says in a surprisingly cheery voice. Compared to that of the Bear woman, Luna must've been a young adult of around 18 or so. As the two make their way towards the sink and cabinets of the kitchen, A nervous shudder runs down your spine as you were in the midst of the two giantesses. "Now where is the bowl?" Luna mumbles while opening a plethora of cabinets and peeking inside.

"It should be on the table, I got it set up already." The Bear Woman responds as the sounds of massive footsteps were heard closing in towards your location. With a nervous gulp, you quickly gaze up as one of the gargantuan females soon stands before the wooden table.
14.title: He was in an enormous Log Cabin Kitchen

141.content:
Just as David was about to gaze upwards from your current position, a sudden darkness begins to overtake the area surrounding him. Once his eyes finally manage to view straight overhead, to his utter shock he spot the snow white fur that adorned the wolfesses massive arm as it stretched right over you. Immediately, he turns his head towards the direction of her furred hand as he manage to spot it gripping a building sized red bowl. "ah Here it is!" Her loud voice bellows high above causing him to cover his ears from the shear volume alone. As David kneels down ever so slightly trying to recuperate his ear drums from the booming sound of the wolfesses voice, he soon slowly begins to stand upwards noticing that the shadow seemed to grow even greater than before. "Now the blue one." The gargantuan canine says to herself as her large emerald eyes gaze down upon the kitchen top.

When things just couldn't seem to get worse for David, The great orbs looming above him soon lock onto his miniscule form. With shocked wide eyes, his mouth goes completely agape as the green pupils of the huge wolf giantess focused on none other than his body. Believing that she was possibly looking somewhere else, he attempts to move ever so slowly slightly to the side, hoping with all his might that she was gazing at some random bowl or pan on the table. To his ever growing dread however, the huge eyes follow his movements as he slowly scuttled towards the right. Unsure whether or not the gargantuan sized wolfess was friendly, let alone if the inhabitants of this strange world would find him as some sort of delicacy, David immediately turns and high tails it down the valley sized Table top.

"H-Hey, wait!" The wolfess calls out as her shadow continues to loom over his tiny form, even when sprinting at full speed.
141.title: My, what big eyes you have...

1411.content:
Despite David's speed, it seemed nearly impossible to outrun the massive foreboding shadow looming above him. Before even having a chance to make it a foots length (To the bear and wolf's size that is), he was soon cast in ultimate darkness as his entire form was suddenly pinned underneath something. Whether it was luck or something entirely different, he was luckily unscathed underneath the huge object as he felt no surge of injuries appearing on his body. Holding his form down, the so called 'object' was no doubt that huge wolfess's massive hand, considering the fact that he managed to feel some leathery like texture above him almost akin to a canines paw. Despite being cast and held in complete darkness, he does manage to hear what sounded like a long sigh from nearby. The wolfess was no doubt relieved from the extremely quick chase, though the only question that remained was whether or not she saw him as food or not.

In just a matter of moments, David feels his body get wrapped up in a surface of soft warm fur and leather as his stomach was suddenly on the verge of leaving his abdomen. It seemed like the wolfess had no idea just how to pick up something so tiny, and it was clear by the quick and sudden movements she used to lift him up form the table. As David was lifted rather harshly from the table, he soon finds his form being pulled immediately towards the right. If he had eaten a meal earlier today, then it would've surely get hurled out by the sudden and unexpected movements of the grip.

"Is something wrong?" Another voice sounded off from outside the shadowy confines. The voice no doubt belonged to that huge bear from earlier as it carried a weight of confusion and worry with each word. With wide eyes, another shudder began to course down David's spine as he feared whether or not the massive wolfess would reveal him to the bear giantess. If one huge humanoid animal wasn't enough, he shivered at the thought of having to contend with two of the giants simultaneously.

14112.content:
"No, nothing is wrong." said Luna gazing at her closed fist. "Everything is perfectly fine."

Luna looked at her closed hand with wonder, she did not dare open her hand in case the creature she caught tried to escape. Even at the moment she saw it she knew it was no ordinary bug. It looked like a miniaturized human like the ones she read about in fairy tales. She felt the creature wiggling as though it were looking for a way out. She raised her fist to her lips and whispered one command.

"Stop!"

The movement in her hand immediately ceased. It understood then. It was intelligent. Good, maybe it was smart enough to say where she was about to put it.

While her Bear friend wasn't looking, Luna slipped the creature into the deep pocket of her dress for safe keeping. If Beth had known about the creature Luna was certain she'd want to let it go rather than have a bit of fun with it. The wolfess had every intention of doing the same, but not just yet.

Maybe she'd keep it as a pet.

David sat and listened to the sounds of the world outside of the pocket. He contemplated escape but thought against it. Even if he could manage to climb out of the pocket there was still a few hundred feet to the floor. As afraid as he was, he couldn't help but feel equally excited. After all, he'd fantasized about something like this for years. His whole life. But Fantasy and reality were two different things. Still, he had a feeling that this wolfess didn't want him dead. If that were the case she'd have killed him already. It was getting warm in the pocket and David found himself removing some articles of clothing. A while later...
14112.title: Luna's little secret

141121.content:
As David was within the fabric confines of Luna's dress pocket, he was slightly tossed about against her massive body as she supposedly walked about the kitchen. In several instances, The great wolfess would remain standing still possibly to help assist the bear giantess with her cooking tasks. Moments later however, David soon finds himself being shaken once more about as the great wolf girl begins to walk to an entirely different area. While it was indeed soft within the insides of the deep pocket, the rocking motion and overall bounciness made it nearly impossible to remain perfectly still in one area. After what seemed like hours hidden from view, a sudden voice emanating from above immediately manages to catch David's attention.

"Your Welcome Beth." Luna says in a happy voice as the bear giantess had her head turned back to thank the canine for her assistance.

"Oh, You know you could always stay and have dinner with us." Beth says, as if rewarding Luna for her help with cooking. "you know, we could always have an extra chair at the table."

"Thank you, but I think I should be heading home by now." Luna insists, eager to finally be able to play with her very own miniaturized human.

"Ah, that's a shame." Beth say giving a small defeated sigh. "but still, if you ever need any help with anything just feel free to ask." She adds while giving a grateful smile to Luna.

"Will do Beth." Luna says nodding her head before quickly making her way out of the kitchen. "Take care now!" After saying her goodbyes and finally managing to make her way out of the Bears residence, Luna lets out a small excited squeal of as she clenches both hands right under her snout. With a giggle she immediately begins to make her way straight to her home, heart racing over her excitement of the whole situation. 'a human!' she shouts in her head as the smile adorned upon her face begins to grow much more wider in size. 'a real life human! I always thought they were in fairytales...but now!' a loud giggle escapes her mouth as she soon manages to finally make her way into her cabin. With quick haste, she makes her way up a stair case before entering into her room. Turning her head back at the doorway, she quickly slides the lock insuring that no one would interrupt, let alone know about this moment.

Back within the confines of the pocket, David found the entire trip a complete dizzying experience. If having to contend with the wolfess walking was enough to leave a headache, then it was a surprise that his brain was still intact by her quick running. After minutes of uncontrollable bouncing and tumbling, the whole area soon begins to calm down as the wolfess suddenly ceases her sudden movements. Before he could even manage to get a chance in catching his breath however, David suddenly notices the white furred digits from before heading straight towards his direction. Unable to even back up, his whole body was soon gripped and lifted out of the fabric confines of the pocket, ascending straight before the massive face of the wolf girl.

As Luna finally managed to pull out the human from within her pocket, her heart flutters slightly as she gazes upon the fairy tale creature in awe. Her eyes soon begin to widen in surprise noticing that some of the human's clothing was missing from his body. With a small giggle, she cocks her had slightly to the side as she peers down his small form. "Why hello there little human~" she says in a sing song voice.

David's eyes widen in surprise once he manages to hear her voice sound off before him. "y-you know what a human is?" he stammers in utter disbelief by the reveal. Did this world carry humans just like him? he thought.

Luna couldn't help but laugh at the dumbfounded reaction the human gave by her words. "Of course I do!" she says with an eager nod of her head. "Humans have always been around in our fairytales." she begins to explain. "Even as a pup, I would always dream of meeting a human one day...and, what do you know?" she giggles.

David found the explanation somewhat hard to swallow. Were humans really nothing more than made up creatures in this strange ginormous world? In just moments, a small shade of red began to emerge on his face by the last comment she made. "w-wait...you mean, you always wanted to meet a human before?" he asks.

Luna nods at the question as the smile on her face was as wide as could be. "Yup!" she chuckles. "oh! there's just so much things we could do together." she giggles.

David's face begins to grow an even darker shade of red by the idea of spending time with this lovely wolfess. However, by the way she was talking it almost seemed as if she was thinking of him as nothing more than a pet or something along those lines. "h-hold on a minute." he quickly stammers. "what do you mean by all that?"

"Isn't it obvious?" Luna smiles. "You'll be staying with me of course!" she beams happily. While Luna was originally thinking of keeping him as nothing more than a pet, the more she thought about the more risky it could be. If Beth or anyone else found out about his existence, then she'd have no choice but to let him go. Not only that, but if she did go a bit overboard and he managed to blurt out everything than there was no telling what this would do to her reputation. Instead of trying to straight u[ force him to stay with her, she instead decided to influence him to stay. Besides, if that didn't work that didn't mean that threat was out of the question. "I mean, where else is it safe for a human?" She asks with a tilted head.

Now that she mentioned it, The wolfess did seem to have a strong point. The only problem with this whole proposition was the fact that David knew absolutely nothing about her. "How can I be so sure that you're not lying?" David asks curiously with a slightly raised brow.

Luna was taken slightly back by the accusation. "Wha!? me? Lie?" she stammers trying to think of someway of gaining his trust quickly. "Well..think about it! I just saved your life back there." she says while pointing a finger at herself. "I mean, if it wasn't for me acting quick, you could've easily become a part of dinner for those bears." she adds hoping that this would perhaps change his mind over her.

Memories of the massive bear woman immediately fill David's head as a nervous shudder courses down his spine. She did have a strong point. Besides, if she really did mean to hurt or eat him, then she would've done it way earlier. "alright...you got a point there." he says giving a sigh. "but...what's the catch?" he asks. "I find it hard to believe that you'd just let me stay here for free."

A massive grin forms on Luna's face as she relishes over her victorious words. "Simple!" she says while pointing a finger out in a matter of fact way. "All you have to do is just spend some time with me." she says. "that and hide if my family tries to come in."

David's eyes widen by the mention of others in her home. "wait...there are more of you!?" he stammers with wide eyes, unsure if it was a safe idea to stay now.

"Y-yes...But! if you stay hidden in my room, then no one will notice." Luna quickly interjects, which manage to calm down the human. "so...do we have a deal?" she asks with curious eyes.

Seeing as how he really didn't have any other options, and fearing that he would have am extremely short life expectancy out on his own, David reluctantly agrees. "deal." he replies.

A squeal of excitement escapes Luna as she gives a small victorious leap. "alright then!" she beams happily. 'Finally...' she thinks to herself. 'A human all for myself.' she giggles. "alright human, now let's..."

15.content:
"What?"

That was the first thought that came to mind as David awoke. Through the thin material of the tent he noted that it was unusually bright. Since he'd pitched tent inside of a decrepit cabin he knew that couldn't be possible. Unless the roof was blown off in the storm, but that didn't make any sense either. The tent would've been ripped to shreds in a storm that powerful. Climbing out of his sleeping bag he unzipped the opening of the tent. What he saw made him think for a momet that he was still asleep.

At first he thought he was looking at a strange and alien tree. But upon closer inspection, and to his astonishment, he was staring up at a carrot. A carrot that was at least 20 feet in diameter, but a carrot none the less. He climbed out of the tent and looked about. He counted 22 such carrots all growing in a straight line. They weren't the only vegetables he found. He also saw Pea pods, cabbage, Pumpkin, all growing at an enormous and impossible scale. Where the heck was he? What the hell had happened during the night? Something moved at the corner of his eye. David turned and saw a Horrifying site. A black ant, as big as he was, had crawled out from under the broad leaves of a cucumber plant. David Froze, unable to move as the ant approached. But much to his surprise, the large insect ignored him and continued on its way. Like a Borg drone from a popular TV series, the ant was a part of a collective hive mind, and had not deemed him as a threat. He breathed a sigh of relief. That was close.Next time he might not be so lucky.

It was time to go. He couldn't stay where he was, even though he didn't know where to go, but it seemed like the only course of action.

Quickly packing away his tent and sleeping bag, David planned on which direction he would go. That decision was ultimately taken away from him with the sound of what could only be described as a door opening, followed by the earth shaking rumble of Godzilla like foot falls. It didn't take long for as to realize the one making those footfalls was heading his way. Somewhere in his brain a little voice was telling him to run, but his curiosity made him stay in place. He had to see who or what it was.

And then he saw her. She loomed above the vegetation like a rising mountain. An anthropomorphic bear of phenomenal size. She was enormous, and totally oblivious to his presence. With a wicker basket in one hand, she walked forward in his direction meandering through the vegetable garden.

Her strides were enormous. The ground heaved with every step she took. The landscape around him shook with the force of her passage. When she was close enough David could see huge furry feet from under the long blue dress she wore. They crushed everything in her path, sinking into the sole from her incredible weight and leaving craters in their wake. He could hear her humming a pleasant tune completely unaware of the danger she was causing. Realized his danger, he thought quickly. Running wasn't an option. The ground shaking too violently now with the impact of her giant steps. Even if it wasn't, he'd have to dodge and weave and navigated the uneven ground .The Bearess would have no such limitations.

With no other options he climbed up into the green leaves of the nearest carrot, and hoped she wouldn't step on it.

Beth stepped out of the home she shared with her husband and two children. It was a beautiful morning, the air was crisp and the birds sang in the trees. Humming to herself she stepped off the front porch and headed towards the garden she'd planted months earlier. The vegetables had grown big enough for her to decide that a salad would be nice for breakfast. Stepping into the garden she paused to pluck a few carrots out of the ground. After depositing them into the wicker basket she held, he collected a few heads of lettuce and various other vegetables before heading back into her home. She was completely unaware of the passenger she'd picked up with the first carrot she pulled out of the ground. It had been a rather frightening experience for David, the sight of an enormous paw-like hand reaching down and closing around him would be enough to scare anyone. Sitting in the bottom of the basket among vegetables, he slid about with every sway of the bearess' arm until everything came to a stop and the basket was placed on a flat surface.

'Okay, now what?' David thought to himself.
15.title: Food of the Gods
